Enroll Now for This Year amd Next Year

span.strong:
Schools Will Be Physically Closed Through
the Remainder of the Current School Year

td.p: On April 17, Texas Governor Greg Abbott extended the physical closure of Texas schools through the end of the 2019-2020 school year. RISD will continue to provide at-home learning and other support for students through the end of the academic year on May 22.

li.a: COVID-19 Impacts and Who to Contact

td.p: Various Assessments Impacted by the COVID-19 Pandemic - updated 3/30/20

ul.li: On March 16, 2020, Texas announced it is waiving STAAR standardized testing requirements for the 2019-2020 school year because of the COVID-19 pandemic. Learn more

ACT district testing for juniors has been canceled. ACT has made the difficult decision to postpone the remaining ACT Junior district testing dates for Spring 2020 in response to the COVID-19 pandemic.
The ACT college admissions test scheduled for April 4 is being rescheduled for June 13. Learn more
The College Board, which owns the SAT test, announced it has canceled its exam scheduled for May 2 and will refund money for students who already registered. Learn more

The College Board has also announced that, due to school closures, AP exams cannot be administered as usual. The College Board is planning to provide all AP exams through a secure 45-minute online free-response test for each course.
On April 3, the College Board released a full exam schedule and specific free-response question types that will appear on each AP exam. RISD teachers will be working with students to prepare them for this new testing format.
The College Board will also be providing free AP review classes which will begin Wednesday, March 25. Students and parents can learn more about exam changes and instructional supports by visiting https://apcentral.collegeboard.org/about-ap/news-changes/coronavirus-update.

p.br: Richardson ISD is providing information to educate, encourage and engage our school community about the 2020 Census, and we encourage your participation.

td.p: The Census Bureau has extended the deadline to respond to the questionnaire to August 14. RISD will keep its Census website up through the extension.

The Census has only 10 questions and is available in 13 languages other than English. And, for the first time, you can respond by mail, phone or online. By responding to the 2020 Census now, you will have done your part to ensure your community gets its fair share of federal funding and representation in Congress.

p.a: Find out more at RISD's Census 2020 website

p.span: Enroll Now for the Upcoming 2020-2021 School Year
p.br: Students currently enrolled and returning to RISD next school year will need a unique code, called a Snapcode, for each returning student in order to enroll. Snapcodes and specific enrollment information were sent home to parents by each RISD school the week of February 17 as follows:

ul.li: Current elementary students – take home packets
Current junior high and high school students – U.S. mail
All current students – message to current primary contact email address on file with child’s school

td.p: If you have not received enrollment information and a snapcode from your child’s school, please contact your child’s current school. Please note that students new to RISD will not require a snapcode to enroll for the upcoming 2020-2021 school year.
All enrollment for the upcoming 2020-21 school year must be completed online – there are no paper forms to complete.
To enroll online, or for more information about online enrollment for the upcoming 2020-21 school year, please visit RISD’s online enrollment site.

p.span: RISD Schools and Central Facilities are Closed

br.strong: RISD schools and central facilities are closed until further notice to support efforts to stem the threat to public health we face from the COVID-19 pandemic.

td.p: Educators are working with students and families to provide at-home learning and other vital services. During this closure, critical operations will continue with a skeleton crew on site. Other staff are working remotely and will attempt to assist with questions to the extent possible under remote work arrangements.
If you have an immediate need, please call the district’s main phone number at 469-593-0000 or email RISD@risd.org. Thank you for your patience and understanding during this time.
